intro: Nebropsis pallida, commonly known as the pale nebropsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a slender stem and opposite leaf arrangement. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
